name: Eilenberg–Ganea conjecture
rephrased: If a group has cohomological dimension 2, then it can be represented by a 2-dimensional Eilenberg-MacLane space.
implication_form: If a group has cohomological dimension 2, then it has geometric dimension 2.
explained: The Eilenberg–Ganea conjecture states that if a group G has cohomological dimension 2 (cd(G) = 2), then it also has geometric dimension 2. Geometric dimension 2 means that G admits a 2-dimensional Eilenberg–MacLane space (aspherical CW complex).
